attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: Charlestown Boys and Girls Club - Day Camp Counselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Help supervise club members in Day camp, carry equipment.
attributes.ideal_candidate: self motivated

attributes.title: Charlestown Boys and Girls Club - Maintenance
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Help Maintenace director keep Club clean.
attributes.ideal_candidate: dependable

attributes.title: Roxbury Community College - Landscaping/Grounds
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Read and able to respond to verbal communication able to lift 25 pounds and stand for periods of time. Responsible cleaning grounds of debris, cut grass, sweep walkways, sweep and mop stairwells and move some furniture.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Someone who is a team player and likes to do this kind of job and takes pride in his/her work. Someone who doesn't mind working outside in the heat and who likes the idea of making the grounds  look beautiful.

attributes.title: Roxbury Community College - Office Reception/Filing
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Proficient in Microsoft Office (word and excel). Excellent organizational, oral and written communication and interpersonal skills. able to handle multiple projects with frequent deadlines. create file folder, sort various office docs in alphabetical order and pull records. Screen and answer telephone calls. Forward calls to appropriate staff or department throughout the campus. Fold letters, documents and stuff in envelopes for office mailings.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Someone who has a friendly personality and is able to deal with public and can follow instructions. Someone who is also a team player.

attributes.site_name: East Boston Neighborhood Health Center: Let's Get Movin'
attributes.title: East Boston Neighborhood Health Center - Let's Get Movin' - Assistant Program Leader
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Form positive relationships with program participants, assist with motivating children to engage in physical activities, be a positive role model for the children, provide set up for games/drills and various activities as directed by the Program Leaders, assist with teaching of games and skills and clean up of activity space. The position requires staff to be outside for most of the day, participating in physical activity, both in outdoor field and pool settings.
attributes.ideal_candidate: The young person who is perfect for this job is someone who is outgoing, likes to be physically active, has a lot of energy and experience with kids. Teens looking to make lasting friendships, gain coaching experience and professional development experience have done very well in years past.

attributes.site_name: The Trustees of Reservations/BNAN: Boston Youth Conservation Corps
attributes.title: The Trustees of Reservations/BNAN - Boston Youth Conservation Corps Urban Wilds - Youth Conservation Corps Member
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Complete restoration and beatification projects such as planting trees, removal of non-native plants and trash cleanup. Work in community gardens to plant, weed, water, harvest and distribute vegetables. Complete basic carpentry projects such as the construction of bridges, boardwalks, benches and picnic tables. Assist with education programs, such as leading summer nature programs for children, creating interpretive materials, and designing educational activities.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Able to perform physical work outdoors in all weather. Interested in learning about the natural environment. Enthusiasm to work as part of a team. Desire to make a difference in your community.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: Phillips Brooks House Association: BRYE, CHAD, FIO, Keylatch, MHSP, NAYEP, RYI, SBOS
attributes.title: Phillips Brooks House Association - RYI - Junior Counselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Works with groups of children for seven weeks during the summer, implementing a self- designed curriculum. Junior Counselors work with college-aged Senior Counselors. You must commit to working from July 1 to August 18, and will have the option of working for an additional week before and after for additional pay. Training  Junior Counselors participate in a mandatory one week training prior to the beginning of camp. This training provides skills in curriculum development and classroom strategies as well as community leadership skills.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Growth mindset, interest working with children and doing community-engaged work, strong work ethic, language capabilities for some sites

attributes.site_name: Phillips Brooks House Association: BRYE, CHAD, FIO, Keylatch, MHSP, NAYEP, RYI, SBOS

attributes.title: Project RIGHT, Inc. - Youth Organizer
attributes.duties_responsbilities: To become a better community leader, by learning more about the Greater Grove Hall community, and taking steps to create positive changes. Engage the community (Survey community residents, prepare mailings for local resident meetings, interview stakeholders, etc). Work collaboratively with a group of participants to create a final project/presentation. Qualifications: Being comfortable in the community and engaging local residents. (From time to time, we conduct surveys or do other projects, in the community.)
attributes.ideal_candidate: We are looking for young people from the Greater Grove Hall area, who want to give back to and improve their community. The ability to work collaboratively and a desire to learn would also be helpful.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: BCYF Roslindale Community Center - KAS Summer
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist senior summer staff with various tasks, set up and clean up of classroom, accompany children in swimming pool, interact with children in gym and on playground and accompany children on field trips. Also to eat with the children during meal times.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Looking for youth with positive attitude, punctual ability to work well with others. Also looking for youth with experience interacting with young children.  Youth must also be able to get into the pool with the children.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: BCYF Roslindale Community Center - 6-12 Year Old Summer Program
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist senior summer staff with various tasks, set up and clean up of classroom, accompany children in swimming pool, interact with children in gym and on playground and accompany children on field trips. Also to eat with the children during meal times.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Looking for youth with positive attitude, punctual ability to work well with others. Also looking for youth with experience interacting with young children.  Youth must also be able to get into the pool with the children.

attributes.title: BCYF Roslindale Community Center - Front Desk
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Youth will be asked to answer the community center main phone line. Direct community members that come into the building, while keeping track of the whereabouts of the different programs in the building. Assist with the creation and distribution of membership cards.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Youth should be a self starter, task oriented punctual, pleasant demeanor and positive attitude.   Youth should also be courteous and eager to help others.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: Roxbury Tenants of Harvard - Counselor-in-Training (CIT)
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist a Group Leader with a group of children in the Summer Enrichment program, engaging in all activities with children, including swimming, daily activities, group management, cleaning spaces, and carrying lunches on trips, provide strong role-modeling by adhering to dress code. Youth must be 16 years old and have a desire and ability to work with children.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Teens who have a passion for working with children, and who are flexible  around their schedule.

attributes.title: Roxbury Tenants of Harvard - Pool Assistant/Junior Lifeguard
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist lifeguards with monitoring safe use of pool by guests, with testing and maintaining proper chemistry of the pool, with cleaning and maintenance of pool/pool areas, and with swimming lessons as requested.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Youth who can swim and want to learn to be a lifeguard, and are able to be outside all day.

attributes.title: Roxbury Tenants of Harvard - Sports Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist with sports programs at RTH, supervising organized activities, leading games, model and teach good sportsmanship, assist with cleaning of gym facility and sports equipment.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Active, physically able youth are encouraged to apply and ability to work with children is preferred.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: Uphams Corner Community Center: Bird Street Community Center
attributes.title: Uphams Corner Community Center - Bird Street Community Center - Jr. Counselors in Training (CIT)
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Junior Counselors will assist Unit Leaders with hands on supervision and mentoring of campers. Supervise children to bathroom changing areas and activity areas. Supervising children during all transitions throughout bird street and camp, set up supplies and equipment for all meals. Provide a safe environment for youth and assigned group at all times - enforce all rules and procedures with children.
attributes.ideal_candidate: A teen who is energetic, loves working outdoors, has great attention to details and has experience managing large groups of children. Youth must also be effective in communicating rules and procedures to children and be comfortable communicating with parents just in case an incident happened involving children in their group.

attributes.site_name: Uphams Corner Community Center: Bird Street Community Center
attributes.title: Uphams Corner Community Center - Bird Street Community Center - Jr. Staff
attributes.duties_responsbilities: As a Bird St. Arts entrepreneur, youth commit to seven weeks of summer study, during which you will learn about creating a business plan, designing and producing a product, and marketing and selling the product. Gain valuable business skills and self-confidence?and earn an additional stipend if available. All arts entrepreneurs also participate in a community service project of some sort. You are only able to choose one option in the Entrepreneurship Program.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Any young person who is creative, has a passion for designing new things. Youth must have a great attention to detail and willingness to work being apart of a team. Any youth who is outgoing and has a willingness to learn will be great fit for any of these jobs. Patience is also key when working with others because it will take time for people to get on the same page to complete a common goal.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: The Salvation Army: Children's Learning Center
attributes.title: The Salvation Army - Children's Learning Center - Camp Helper
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Camp Helpers will assist the team leaders and program site coordinator in the day to day tasks of the summer program. These tasks include: Cleaning Setting up for activities Interacting with the children. Help maintain order and behavior. Join the kids in the pool during swim time. Help with lunch time.
attributes.ideal_candidate: We are looking for teens who can help us provide a safe environment for our kids. Any arts and crafts skills or affinity for outdoor play is most welcome.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: Boston Kroc Center: Summer with RJ
attributes.title: Boston Kroc Center - Summer with RJ - Group Leader
attributes.duties_responsbilities: The main function of the Group Leader is to assist and participate in the day-to-day operations of the Summer program. Keep all areas where participants are located in an organized and clean manner.  Ensure that events and activities begin and end on time.  Transition participates to program/activity areas  Ensure participant safety. Assist and direct program participants in moving about the facility to avoid crowded conditions and maximize service efficiency.  Lead youth through active and supportive guidance and creative activities.
attributes.ideal_candidate: We are looking to hire teens who have a passion for the community, who enjoy working with you. Teens who would love to be active throughout the summer. Also, a teen looking for leadership experience this summer would be a great fit.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: BCYF Holland Community Center - Junior Counselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist the group leader in the childcare department and summer program., under the supervision of the school age staff. Teens will assist the group leaders in structured age appropriate activities. Activities include recreational sports, arts & crafts, field trips, theater, music and education. They will also serve as role models and provide academic support as needed.
attributes.ideal_candidate: The ideal young person that would be the best candidate for this position, is someone who is passionate about working with children, and others of all abilities, enjoys implementing activities, organizing, energetic, flexible, mobilizing, self-aware, and clear on boundaries, etc.

attributes.title: BCYF Holland Community Center - Junior Athletic Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist the Athletic Department in day-to-day recreational activities including programming, games, preparing gym for activities, assisting in recreational activities, and keeping children engaged while in the gymnasium.
attributes.ideal_candidate: The ideal young person for this position enjoys being in the gym, enjoys different recreational activities, and is energetic, mobilizing, dedicated, and compassionate.

attributes.title: BCYF Holland Community Center - Junior Clerical Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist the Program Supervisor, Staff Assistant, Youth Worker, and Program Assistant in specific clerical duties to include... filing documents, answering phones, operating the xerox machine, assisting in developing and implementing and facilitating programs, workshops, and training's for teens and other youth; in addition to providing support in maintaining payroll for youth staff.
attributes.ideal_candidate: The ideal candidate for this position will potentially possess some type of office/ clerical skills, some type of customer service & computer literacy skills, or the willingness and open interest in learning and gaining skills in these specific areas.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: Sportsmen's Tennis & Enrichment Center - Summer Camp Counselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist senior coaching staff with on-court instruction and camper management. Assist senior staff with providing tennis instruction to campers from outside organizations and agencies. Assist with overseeing breakfast, lunch and snacks. Accompany senior staff to the pool and help to oversee the safety of campers while swimming. Assist senior staff during the afternoon extra-curricular rotation (includes literacy component). Accompany senior staff on field trips and assist managing campers while on field trips.
attributes.ideal_candidate: The young person who would be ideal for the position of summer camp counselor or counselor in training should be energetic, enthusiastic, positive risk-taker, zest for learning, ability to take initiative and desires to be a leader.

attributes.title: BCYF Madison Park Community Center - Gym Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Gym assistant: must help maintaining required documentations and organizing events. As well as doing marketing and promoting.  Cleaning and Organizing also typical duties is part of an assistant athletic director job.
attributes.ideal_candidate: A person who is sport knowledgeable.

attributes.title: BCYF Madison Park Community Center - Building Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Building assistant: help manage and maintain building.  Secure building, Sign in participants
attributes.ideal_candidate: A person who is welcoming, a person who is responsible. a person who is willing to engage participants and secure certain areas.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: BCYF Madison Park Community Center - Peer Leader
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Peer Leader: is responsible for planning, leading, and implementing core and non-core programs and experiences for children in a small group setting. They will also be responsible for the general safety and development, growth, and skill achievement of the participants in his/her group.
attributes.ideal_candidate: A person who likes working with younger children. who take initiative.

attributes.site_name: St Marys Center for Women and Children / GRLZ Radio: GRLZ Radio
attributes.title: St Marys Center for Women and Children / GRLZ Radio - GRLZ Radio - On-Air Personality
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist team with picking topics, themes, and segments for radio show. Handle assigned tasks and responsibilities for show as requested by Peer Leaders and GRLZ Radio staff. Work with team to make sure that all deadlines are met for editing and broadcasting of the shows. Conceptualize creative ideas for show themes and topics. Take on special projects as needed. Research content for radio broadcasts. Participate in group discussions that lead to content decisions for the show.
attributes.ideal_candidate: This position would be perfect for teen girls interested in journalism, communications, or technology. We are looking for outgoing, assertive, and open minded girls.

attributes.title: Transformative Culture Project - Beyond Creative - Youth Producer
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Youth Producers are expected to participate in all trainings and programmings. They will be trained in the technical aspects of media production, from the anatomy of the camera to creating compelling compositions, to capturing high quality audio. Youth Producers will also become familiar with various editing softwares such as Adobe Premier Pro and Final Cut Pro. In addition to technical mastery, Youth Producers will also be expected to engage with deepening their artistic sensibilities.
attributes.ideal_candidate: We are looking to recruit youths who are highly interested in the media arts and creating video content from well-crafted stories. Youths who are great storytellers or have an eye for good design would be a good fit. Even if youths do not have prior experience in filmmaking or media arts, we will train them so that is not a prerequisite. We are looking for youths who are interested in learning these skills and thinking about pursuing a career in the arts.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: Youth Enrichment Services - Outdoor Adventure Leader
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Learn and instruct youth on the basics of mountain biking, hiking, kayaking and rock climbing. Collaborate plan, organize and lead programs and outdoor experiences. Be an ambassador of YES by actively showing respect for self, others and the environment. Attend staff meetings, seminars and trainings as required. Manage the safety of participants and administer first aid if necessary youth should be willing to work outdoors. Youth should be comfortable with dogs.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Youth who are interested in challenging themselves physically and mentally, who are comfortable with varies outdoor environments, and who are willing to take a leadership role.

attributes.site_name: The Skating Club of Boston: Boston Common Frog Pond
attributes.title: The Skating Club of Boston - Boston Common Frog Pond - Pool Attendant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Pool Attendants at the Frog Pond work almost exclusively outdoors and are frequently in the water. They are responsible for the following: enforcing pool rules to ensure patron safety and enjoyment, using a dipnet to clear debris from the pool, assisting with basic cleaning as needed, answering patron questions in a courteous manner.
attributes.ideal_candidate: This position is great for people who love being around people and being outdoors. This position involves lots of customer interaction. Ideal candidates are detail-oriented, attentive, courteous, and outgoing.  Young people who are water safety certified or interested in becoming lifeguards are encouraged to apply. However, swimming skills are not required or necessary as the pool is quite shallow.

attributes.site_name: The Skating Club of Boston: Boston Common Frog Pond
attributes.title: The Skating Club of Boston - Boston Common Frog Pond - Lifeguard
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Lifeguards at the Frog Pond work almost exclusively. Unlike standard indoor pools, lifeguards at the wading pool are frequently in the water. They are responsible for the following: enforcing pool rules to ensure patron safety and enjoyment, using a dipnet to clear debris from the pool, assisting with basic cleaning as needed, answering patron questions in a courteous manner, basic water testing (training provided if not included in lifeguard certification course), basic first aid.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Loves being around people and being outdoors. This position involves lots of customer interaction. Ideal candidates are detail-oriented, attentive, courteous, and outgoing. All applicants MUST be lifeguard certified on or before March 30th, 2018. Those who will not be certified on or before that date are encouraged to apply as pool attendants instead.

attributes.title: The Theater Offensive - True Colors Intern
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist the Youth Programs Manager with running True Colors Creative Action Crew and Studio. Availability during standard business hours is preferred; some evening/weekend work required.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Strong communications skills (written, verbal) Able to work independently on administrative tasks Knowledgable of Google platform Desire to work in creative/community spaces Superb time management skills Experience working with youth theater ensembles and/or teaching artists Able manage working of several projects Can think on your feet. Commitment to mission of The Theater Offensive

attributes.title: The Theater Offensive - Programs Intern
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist the Programs Department staff in three main areas: evaluation, arts research and assisting with ongoing programs and productions. The intern's work will include hands-on experience with systems that track the impact of past programming, maintain current operations and plan for the future. Comfort with Microsoft Office and Google suite a plus. Availability during standard business hours (10am-6pm) is preferred; some evening/weekend work required.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Strong communications skills (written, verbal) Able to work independently on administrative tasks Knowledgable of Google platform Desire to work in creative/community spaces Superb time management skills Experience working with youth theater ensembles and/or teaching artists Able manage working of several projects Can think on your feet. Commitment to mission of The Theater Offensive

attributes.title: The Theater Offensive - Pride Youth Theater Alliance Intern
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Support internal and external communication activity in order to improve engagement and participation among members and increase awareness of PYTA programs throughout the queer arts, youth leadership and theatre education sectors. TTO is a member of the Pride Youth Theater Alliance as well as its administrative host. Learn more about PYTA at www.prideyouththeateralliance.org.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Strong communications skills (written, verbal). Able to work independently on administrative tasks. Knowledgable of Google platform. Desire to work in creative/community spaces. Superb time management skills. Experience working with youth theater ensembles and/or teaching artists. Able manage working of several projects. Can think on your feet. Commitment to mission of The Theater Offensive.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: Boys and Girls Club of Boston: Yawkey Boys and Girls Club of Roxbury
attributes.title: Boys & Girls Club of Boston - Yawkey Boys & Girls Club of Roxbury - Junior Staff
attributes.duties_responsbilities: The delivery of quality and developmentally appropriate department-specific programs, activities, services, and special events. Junior Staff receive on-the-job youth development training under the supervision of assigned adult staff in program areas. Assist in the monitoring of members participating in programs and services within the program area as well as throughout the clubhouse as deemed appropriate. Report any disciplinary or other issues to the supervisor.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Experience working with children and youth preferred but not required. Knowledge of youth development principles. Good interpersonal and communication skills required. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. The ability to lift 30 lbs. or more.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: Boys and Girls Club of Boston: Yawkey Boys and Girls Club of Roxbury
attributes.title: Boys & Girls Club of Boston - Yawkey Boys & Girls Club of Roxbury - Kitchen Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Prepares and serves food to 6-18 year old club members as part of Kids Caf? program. Assists in the supervision of members participating in programs and services within the kitchen. Secure and maintain materials, equipment and other resources belonging to the kitchen area. Maintains a safe and clean kitchen/cafeteria area. Participate in meetings/trainings regarding Kids Cafe as needed. Other duties as assigned by supervisor.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Knowledge of kitchen operations and food preparation required. Experience working with children. Organized and reliable. Ability to lift 50 lbs or more.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: All Dorchester Sports & Leadership: ADSL Summer Program
attributes.title: All Dorchester Sports & Leadership - ADSL Summer Program
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Staff is expected to help provide and maintain a safe, fun and learning environment. Energetic and self-motivated staff will be responsible for leading hands-on activities, cleaning and setting up games, lessons, and programs as instructors give commands and lead groups through an array of indoor and outdoor activities. Staff must be outgoing, attentive and willing to listen to not just Senior staff but Participants as well. Staff must be willing to travel to different sites for field trips and off-site activities.
attributes.ideal_candidate: We are looking for energetic, well mannered mature teens who have experience working with kids in a fast-paced environment and communicate well with others. Staff should have a passion for young people and a passion for their community.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: Boston Parks and Recreation: ParkARTS Programming
attributes.title: Boston Parks and Recreation - ParkARTS Programming - ParkARTS Artist Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Artist Assistant is responsible for working with children on a daily basis. The Assistant will  assist the Artist with preparation work (i.e. getting materials, organizing materials, any other prep work deemed necessary by artists) .  Plan activities that give children the opportunity to express themselves creatively. Facilitate activities that give children a sense of accomplishment that comes from mastering techniques and completing projects.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Responsible youth that can ensure children's safety and manage their behavior. Work closely with the Head Artist to ensure participation and inclusion for all. Enthusiasm when working with children. Strive to be a role model and mentor for young participants.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: Castle Square Tenants Organization (CSTO): Square Roots
attributes.title: Castle Square Tenants Organization (CSTO) - Square Roots - Assistant Group Leader
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Under the supervision of CSTO's Program Coordinator (full-time) and Group Leader (seasonal full-time professional educator), the Assistant Group Leader (teen employee) will co-plan and assist with: daily activities, deliver curriculum, field trip chaperoning, administrative duties, maintaining cleanliness.
attributes.ideal_candidate: We are looking for teens with an interest in working with school-aged children. We would like someone who takes initiative in improving the program. Teens have the opportunity to bring their own interest and hobbies and using that to create their own workshop/activity.

attributes.title: Boston Chinatown Neighborhood Center - Childcare Program Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Summer Teen Staff will support daycare teachers in maintaining a safe space for children to learn and play. Teens will support in preparing, setting up, and cleaning up after activities. Teens will also supervise children during meal time and play time.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Responsible. Enjoys working with children. Firm and assertive with children. Outgoing and able to build rapport with children participants quickly. Ability to work independently and in groups. Ability to take initiative and develop their leadership roles.

attributes.title: Boston Chinatown Neighborhood Center - Operations Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Summer Teen Staff are responsible for customer service and operational tasks, such as answering phone calls, data entry, minimal space maintenance, and greeting clients at the front desk.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Responsible. Enjoys customer service. Outgoing and friendly. Ability to work independently and in groups. Takes initiative to develop their leadership role. Has experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Google Suite.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: Boston Chinatown Neighborhood Center - Youth Center Program Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Summer Teen Staff is a summer part-time position that works with the staff and program participants under supervision of the youth program staff. S/he assists Youth Center staff in summer program/fieldtrips. S/he also supervises youth participants in the youth center lounge by creating a safe environment where youth can develop healthy relationships, and engage in positive interactions. S/he is also responsible for helping to maintain the daily operations of the Youth Center.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Responsible. Enjoys working with youth. Firm and assertive with youth. Outgoing and able to build rapport with youth quickly. Clear about boundaries between youth and staff. Ability to work independently and in groups. Takes initiative to develop their leadership roles.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: America Scores New England, Inc.: Boston Scores Summer Learning Academy
attributes.title: America Scores New England, Inc.: Boston Scores Summer Learning Academy - Junior Counselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Work with the Summer Associate and coaches in supervising, monitoring, and participating in all activities including field trips, arts and crafts, sports and games. Junior counselors are expected to serve as an appropriate role model for the children under their direction. Groups must participating in all camp activities. Set a good example for campers punctuality, sharing clean-up responsibilities, and good sportsmanship. Other reasonable duties may be assigned as required by the Camp Director(s)
attributes.ideal_candidate: Love soccers, enjoys being outdoors and working with younger kids, has a connection to East Boston community, and comfortable speaking to students in both English and Spanish. Willing to work at East Boston summer learning academy site at Mario Umana Academy.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: America Scores New England, Inc.: Boston Scores Summer Learning Academy - HYDE PARK
attributes.title: America Scores New England, Inc.: Boston Scores Summer Learning Academy - Junior Counselor - Hyde Park
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Work with the Summer Associate and coaches in supervising, monitoring, and participating in all activities including field trips, arts and crafts, sports and games. Junior counselors are expected to serve as an appropriate role model for the children under their direction. Groups must participating in all camp activities. Set a good example for campers punctuality, sharing clean-up responsibilities, and good sportsmanship. Other reasonable duties may be assigned as required by the Camp Director(s)
attributes.ideal_candidate: Loves soccer, enjoys being outdoors and working with younger kids (grades 3-5), has a connection to/familiarity with the Hyde Park community. Willing to work at our Hyde Park summer learning academy site at the Henry Grew School.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: YMCA of Greater Boston - Charlestown - Admin Asst, Camp Support, Facilities
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Giving Tours to New Members.  Assist in maintaining accurate program records including incident reports, logbook documentation, and daily attendance. Know and understand ALL emergency procedures associated with the camp programn this includes but is not limited to being responsible for your campers' safety and their whereabouts at all times.  Set up and break down. Light maintenance work: changing of light bulbs, unclog toilets, some patching and painting walls and any other reasonable request.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Friendly, outgoing personality. Somebody great with Public Speaking. Enjoys getting their hands dirty. Working with Chilren. Being Independent, Self-Starter.  Strong organizational skills with ability to manage multiple tasks and responsibilities. Strong customer service orientation. Ability to interact with all levels of staff. Technologically savvy in handling of administrative practices. Strong verbal and listening skills. Self-starter with ability to manage own work with minimal supervision.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: BGCD - Walter Denney Youth Center - Recreation Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Thorough Instruction/Continuous Supervision/Will work closely with Teen Employee   Purpose and Objectives  The Recreation Assistant position is responsible for working with the Program Director and/or Unit Director to  supervision a recreation area. Would also assist with transportation and supervision to off-site activities.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Qualification: Must be enthusiastic, hard working and be able to work with members of all ages. Ideal candidates will have an interest in recreation and enjoy hands-on activity participation.

attributes.site_name: Center for Community Health Education Research and Service, Inc.: Community Voices: Speaking Truth
attributes.title: Center for Community Health Education Research and Service, Inc. - Community Voices: Speaking Truth - Youth Researcher
attributes.duties_responsbilities: From the start of the program, the youth participants will be trained to be youth researchers. This entails widening their base knowledge of the issues through assigned readings, film screenings, and some independent study. They will learn fundamental statistics and several different methodologies for data collection.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Value working as part of a team and has capacity to work hard independently. Enthusiastic and open to learning more about health and health issues and would enjoy working on a health related project. May be considering a career in health and who feel connected to their community.

attributes.title: BCYF Ohrenberger Community Center - Assistant Gymnastics Couch
attributes.duties_responsbilities: The assistant gymnastic coach is responsible for helping with the daily running of the gymnastic program.  Follow the direction of the head coach when giving instructions to the gymnastics members. Work individually or in small groups with the gymnasts on certain skills they are learning in class. assist with the set up and break down of the gymnastic equipment. Assist with gymnastic meets as they occur .Assume other duties as directed by the gymnastic coach.
attributes.ideal_candidate: a young person who has a interest in the field of gymnastics.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: BCYF Ohrenberger Community Center - Junior Counselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: The junior counselors will be responsilble for assisting withdailey routines in the preschool and summer programs. The Head Counselors and Directors will provide support guidance and supervision to the junior counselors. Act as an appropriate role model for the children in the program. Help to ensure a safe environment for the children. Assist in the daily set up and break down of the program space. Actively participate with the children in their program activities. Dress appropriately for activities including swimming . Work 25 hours a week.
attributes.ideal_candidate: The teen must have a interest in working with children. He/She must have a positive attitude,be flexible,able to follow directions, respectful, caring and a good role model for the children in the programs.

attributes.title: BCYF City Hall Child Care - Office Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Must have some skills working with computers and simple office task.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Flexibility/Energetic Willing to learn

attributes.title: BCYF City Hall Child Care -Youth Counselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assisting classroom teachers with daily activities and task. Teen will attend field trips.
attributes.ideal_candidate: All youth deserve to work in a diverse environment.  The teen should be respectful and willing to learn.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: East Boston Central Catholic School: East Boston Central Catholic School Summer Program
attributes.title: East Boston Central Catholic School - East Boston Central Catholic School Summer Program - Junior Conselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist in the direction, supervision, and organization of members within activities and throughout the program in order to meet the intended member outcomes. Apply  youth development principles working with members through relationship development, respect for diversity, involvement, and empowerment of youth. Assure members are properly supervised at all times. Be aware of and implement safety guidelines. Participate in the development and implementation of program activities for members.
attributes.ideal_candidate: A youth employee with the desire to work with younger children and to be a good role model for the those children.

attributes.site_name: Boston Parks & Recreation Department: Boston Neighborhood Basketball League (BNBL)
attributes.title: Boston Parks and Recreation Department - Boston Neighborhood Basketball League (BNBL) - Scorekeepers, Timekeepers, Referees
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Keep score and time for basketball games. Work with kids 6-10 overseeing basketball skills and drills competition. Referee youth games for kids 6-10.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Young people interested in basketball. Youth interested in becoming basketball referees on day.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: Salesian Boys & Girls Club - Assistant Counselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Responsible for aiding Adult Program Staff with day to day supervision of campers ages 6-12. Junior Staff help set up and facilitate activities for campers such as athletic gym games, small group activities, arts and crafts and field trip outings. Assistant counselors also help monitor lunch periods for campers. Assistant counselors are responsible for providing a safe, positive and motivating environment for our campers while acting as someone they can look up to.
attributes.ideal_candidate: The perfect young person for this job would have an interest in working with children in a summer camp setting. This person may be considering a career with children or recreation. We are looking individuals with high energy, positive attitudes and a passion for making in impact on the young people in our community.

attributes.title: Salesian Boys & Girls Club - Front Desk Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: This teen would provide information to club parents, answer phone calls, accurately record attendance, provide proper guidance to youth in program areas, enter members into our computer tracking system, make phone calls to confirm information with community partners such as field trip hosts and visitors of the program, oversee front desk supplies and equipment, keep front desk area clean and organized.
attributes.ideal_candidate: The teen that would be perfect for this job would have an interest in serving youth children in a more administrative setting. This teen would want to learn about office functions and community service. Some skills needed for this position are organization, multi tasking, customer service and knowledge of Microsoft office programs Word & Excel.

attributes.title: Salesian Boys & Girls Club - Maintenance Staff
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist adult staff members with general upkeep of program areas. This individual would be responsible for cleaning inside and outside of club facility. Sweeping, mopping and sanitizing of floors, surfaces and windows of our club. This person may also be assigned to landscape fields and perimeters of the building.
attributes.ideal_candidate: The perfect young person for this job would have an interest in working with small groups or individually. They may have in an interest in facility operations and building management. They would support the mission of providing a clean and healthy environment to our campers but may not work with them directly often.

attributes.title: Fresh Truck - Operations Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Help prepare buses for weekly market. Provide customer service and retail support to market managers during market hours.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Passion for food justice, has a connection to roxbury/dorchester community. Experience in food service/retail industry.

attributes.title: BCYF Mildred Ave Community Center - Gym Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Their duties will be assisting the athletic Director, Athletic Assistant and the groups in all recreation and sports and fitness equipment, the locker room, bleachers and gym area. Help set up and break down all programs.
attributes.ideal_candidate: A person who like working with children/youth ages 5-18 yrs. old. Need to have some knowledge in a variety of sports and recreation activities.  Must be willing to participates with all group activities. As well as, setting up., cleaning gym & fitness center and breaking down the activities.

attributes.title: BCYF Mildred Ave Community Center - Office Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: The person  must have basic skill necessary for an office support position.  They will be assigned to tasks that will include computer work, filing, typing, copy, faxing and correspondence to other agencies. Working on special projects and taking messages.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Someone who has experience in an office environment.  Must have good customer service and be polite.  Willing to assist other staff with their office needs.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: BCYF Mildred Ave Community Center - Junior Camp Counselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: The Junior Camp Counselor will be assisting the Group leader with the set-up of all programs and activities. They will be interacting with with children on all activities such as individual and group games, field trips and special events.  They will clean up after each activity and help with lunch and snack duties. Always, assist on field trips, monitor conduct and any other duties require by the group leader.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Someone who has passion and enjoys working with children.  He/ she needs to be engaging, active, and attentive.  The person must be responsible and know hoe to deal with children.  Should always conduct themselves appropriately.

attributes.site_name: Boston Parks & Recreation Department: East Boston Sports Center
attributes.title: Boston Parks & Recreation Department - East Boston Sports Center - Jr. Sport Specialist
attributes.duties_responsbilities: As a member of the East Boston Sport Center Staff Jr. Sports Specialist is responsible to assist the Supervisor in all aspects and activities of the East Boston Sport Center program. Responsible to assist with children at the program when and where needed. Must be able to follow through with directions and instructions. May be responsible to help with one child for the entire program day. May be responsible for helping other counselors in the group who may need assistance throughout the day.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Energetic. Likes working with children. Likes working outside. Likes sport activities.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.site_name: Boston Centers for Youth & Families: Summer Fun Stops
attributes.title: BCYF Leahy Holloran Community Center - Summer Fun Stops - Junior Supervisor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Summer Fun Stops junior supervisors will be tasked with assisting the Summer Fun Stops Site Supervisor and Community Center staff in the creation and implementation of a safe and interactive drop-in program for Boston Youth.  Specific duties include: -Observe and promote all program rules and regulations -Assist in headcounts -Actively participate in program activities -Serve as a positive role model to youth -Assist in maintaining the cleanliness and safety of program space -Assist in planning and implementing activities
attributes.ideal_candidate: Youth wishing to work in the Fun Stops program should have a passion for working with youth and leading recreational activities as well as arts and crafts.   Youth should be: - Enthusiastic - Flexible - Patient - Willing to learn

attributes.site_name: Boys & Girls Clubs of Dorchester: N/A
attributes.title: Boys & Girls Clubs of Dorchester - Recreation Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Responsible for working with an adult Program Director to supervision a recreation area (gym, pool, gamesroom, arts, outdoor athletic area, music, teen center, etc.) and assisting with programs as needed.  Organizational Relationships: Reports directly to the respective Program Director he/she is assigned to. May also receive feedback from the VP of Education and the VP of Programming.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Enthusiastic, hard working and be able to work with members of all ages. Ideal candidates will have an interest in recreation and enjoy hands-on activity participation.

attributes.site_name: Boys & Girls Clubs of Dorchester: N/A
attributes.title: Boys & Girls Clubs of Dorchester - Kids Cafe Assistant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Responsible for working with the Kids Caf? Director to prepare an a.m. breakfast and afternoon lunch for members. Will also assist maintaining kitchen and storage areas with supervision of members while in the program.  Organizational Relationships: Reports directly to the Kids Cafe Director. May also receive feedback from the VP of Operations and the VP of Programming.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Enthusiastic, hard working and be able to work with members of all ages. Ideal candidates will have an interest in culinary arts, nutrition and enjoy hands-on work activities.

attributes.site_name: Boys & Girls Clubs of Dorchester: N/A
attributes.title: Boys & Girls Clubs of Dorchester - Maintenance Assistants
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Work with the Facilities Director and Building Custodian to complete a daily list of maintenance projects. Organizational Relationships: Reports directly to the Facilities Director and Building Custodian. May also receive feedback from the VP's of Programming.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Enthusiastic, hard working and be able to work with all Program Directors and members of all ages. Ideal candidates will be able to work indoors and outdoors and enjoy physical activity.

attributes.title: BCYF Perkins Community Center - Front Desk
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Greet visitors, answer phones, answer doors, have 1st hand knowledge of what is taking place in the building, direct people to various locations within the building, learn bostrax, can cards and enter new members into system.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Someone who can multitask, work independently once given direction/training, someone with great interpersonal relationship skills, someone is polite and assertive

attributes.title: BCYF Perkins Community Center - Locker Room Attendant
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Enforce locker room rules, assist groups by making sure swimmers are putting their belongings in lockers and showering before entering the pool. Assist with keep locker room clean and organized, e.g. no clothes all over the place, floors kept as dry as possible.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Someone who doesn't mind a quiet environment. One who is assertive and doesn't mind providing order.

attributes.title: BCYF Perkins Community Center - Junior Counselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assist lead teachers by keeping kids in eye sight at all times, interact with kids in a positive manner, engage them in activities and group work. Assist with set up and clean up from activities, assist with creating activities kids can do as a group. No cell phone use. As a group of workers you will be creating and implementing games/activities for the kids.

attributes.duties_responsbilities: The Youth Development Program (YDP) holds an open invitation for high school students (ages 14-18) to apply for Peer Leader positions. IBA hires 25 Peer Leaders during the summer, allowing participants to earn compensation for programming each week, up to 20 hours in the summer. The opportunities offered through YDP prepare participants for college, and involvement in the community .
attributes.ideal_candidate: Committed and passionate about social justice, art, and community service. IBA prioritizes youth from Villa Victoria and the South End/Lower Roxbury neighborhoods. Strong interpersonal skills and interest in the arts, and in need of the supportive structured program that we offer.

attributes.title: Boston Asian: Youth Essential Service - Peer Educator
attributes.duties_responsbilities: YES Peer Educator duties and responsibilities is to:  -Assist program staff in planning and developing activities for youth development programs.  -Create media projects such as video PSAs, educational materials and flyers to raise awareness on public health issues.  -Create community surveys and work with community members on public health issues.  -Research information related to topic for programs.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Qualifications and requirements:  -Computer and creative media skills -Be able to work in a teamwork environment -Good communications skills -Bilingual in English, Chinese or Vietnamese preferred.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support

attributes.site_name: Level Ground Mixed Martial Arts: Level Ground Student Trainer program
attributes.title: Level Ground Mixed Martial Arts - Level Ground Student Trainer Program- Student Trainer

The 12- month program is composed of three phases described previously.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Has an interest in fitness and is open to exploring a career in the fitness industry. High work ethic. Positive attitude. Demonstrates leadership, or would like to actively learn skills to cultivate leadership qualities. Respectful.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: Dorchester Bay EDC - Summer Camp CITs
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Provide leadership and guidance to all campers. Take primary responsibility for the health and well-being of campers. Enforce the rules and policies of camp. Work together with the entire staff for the welfare of the camp and campers.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Must be a good role model Must be willing to learn Must like arts Must be comfortable working in Dorchester

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: Harry McDonough Sailing Center (HMSC) - Junior Sailing Counselor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Teach safety, boat handling and sailing theory to children that includes: Develop and follow lesson plans that include dry land and on-the-water drills and inclement weather activities. Have empathy for the students and adapt to their individual needs. Notify students of changes in class times, postponement due to weather conditions and make-up dates. Accurate records of attendance, injuries. Care and maintain boats and facility. Provide general and on-shore assistance to users and other sailing instructors.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Teens with a knowledge and perhaps participation in the HMSC program previously as a counselor or a former student.

attributes.title: Chinatown Main Street - Office Assistance
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Assisting the executive director in daily task  attend meeting , take note, and manage calendar and office help.

attributes.duties_responsbilities: Be between the ages of 16 and 18 and currently enrolled as a sophomore, junior, or senior in high school. attributes.title: Company One Theatre -  Production Apprentice

attributes.ideal_candidate: Value the intersection of art and community. Located at the Strand Theatre so those with a connection to the Upham's Corner neighborhood could be a good fit as well.

attributes.title: DotHouse Health - Assistant in the Facilities Department

Assist with other tasks as needed.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Organized, takes initiative, can take direction, good judgment, strong interpersonal skills. Has basic computer skills

attributes.title: DotHouse Health - Assistant - IT Department

attributes.ideal_candidate: Organized, motivated, can take direction. Interest in computer technology. Has basic computer skills.

attributes.ideal_candidate: Organized, can take direction, positive personality, comfortable speaking with adults and peers. Enjoys planning events that are in support of peers. Has basic computer skills

attributes.site_name: Lena Park Community Development Corporation: Youth Development Program

attributes.duties_responsbilities: Familiar with technology and interested in working with tools and equipment in this fabrication lab. Lab assistants work 3 days per week plus attend a 1-hr staff meeting each week. Position pays $11 per hour, 25 hours a week. Assist with breakfast and lunch service. Help Fab Lab Coordinator with set up and clean up between classes. Help students with class projects and activities.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Has both technical and interpersonal skills and an interest in community development work serving an underserved population. The ideal applicant will be a maker, tinkerer, and/or aspiring engineer as well as a community activist, entrepreneur, and interdependent thinker.

attributes.site_name: Lena Park Community Development Corporation: Youth Development Program

Greet visitorsRegister new members. Check in all visitors and members Help members get to their programs and activities
attributes.ideal_candidate: Enjoys interfacing with parents, other youth, and those who need assistance as the front desk point of contact for the building. Attention to detail. Orderly and organized. Interest in improving computer admin skills, providing support to behind the scenes program tasks.

attributes.site_name: Lena Park Community Development Corporation: Youth Development Program

Hours are 8:30 am to 4 pm, Mon-Fri (Lab assistants work 3 days per week) plus one hour a week for staff meetings. Position pays $11 per hour for 25 hours of work each week. Duties: Assist with breakfast and lunch service.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Wants to practice his/her skills in working with IT professionals and want to learn more about how to operate a computer lab. This person will begin to understand the IT network of Lena Park and be able to trouble shoot with the IT Manager.

attributes.site_name: Kwong Kow Chinese Schoool: Kwong Kow Summer Program
attributes.title: Kwong Kow Chinese Schoool - Kwong Kow Summer Program - Teaching Assistant

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support

attributes.title: The Boston Project Ministries - Eco-Teens
attributes.duties_responsbilities: The Boston Project is seeking youth, ages 15-18, to join our team as Eco-Teen Artists. Youth will learn about what it means for a neighborhood to come together to create a beautiful community, demonstrated in its art, its gardens and its people. This is a hands-on position that involves working outdoors.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Youth who see their community as a positive place, or have a desire to make it a great place to live would be a great match. We are also looking for young people who are flexible and adaptable. Youth who live in or near South Dorchester.  Those who like to work on a team.

Youth who participate in MJE's Peer Leadership Program are educated around social justice issues and empowered to utilize and apply their learning's in their community.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: Piers Park Sailing Center - Youth Instructor
attributes.duties_responsbilities: The sailing instructor will be first contact that the student has with PPSC. Must be enthusiastic about the sport of sailing and seek to expose students to the fundamentals of sailing as well as the importance of the natural environment in which we sail and the basic leadership skills inherent in the sport of sailing. The Instructor must be able to teach safety, boat handling, and sailing theory to children and young adults in dinghies (FJs) and keelboats (Sonars & Colgate) who are beginning, intermediate, or experienced with sailing.
attributes.ideal_candidate: A teen who is passionate about mentoring and supporting youth and enjoys being on the waterfront.

attributes.site_name: Catholic Charitable Bureau of the Archdiocese of Boston, Inc.: Teen Center at St. Peters (Teen Center)
attributes.title: Catholic Charitable Bureau of the Archdiocese of Boston, Inc. - Teen Center at St. Peter?s (Teen Center) - Counselor-in-Training (CIT)
attributes.duties_responsbilities: With the constant support of Teen Center staff, youth CITs are responsible for helping: maintain a safe environment for youth to recreate safely throughout the summer; supervise youth; support the implementation of the St. Peter's English Language Learner Summer Enrichment Academy; plan and implement projects like the Teen Center's recycling initiative and the Teen Caf?; perform administrative duties; and assist older staff as needed.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Demonstrate excellent school attendance and strong academic performance, maturity and respect for boundaries with peers and adults of diverse backgrounds, and ability to accept constructive criticism and incorporate suggestions. Also demonstrate a positive attitude and ability to mentor peers and serve as a positive role model to others. Fluency or advanced bilingual ability in both English and Cape Verdean Creole is highly desired.

attributes.site_name: Discovering Justice: The James D. St.Clair Court Education Project
attributes.title: Discovering Justice: The James D. St.Clair Court Education Project - Program Intern
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Support and lead mock trials administration and support operations for our key programs serving kindergarten through eighth grade from schools across Massachusetts. Working closely with a dynamic team of passionate educators. Responsibilities: Intern duties and responsibilities may include:  Supporting our spring and summer Stand Up for Your Rights mock appellate program for middle and high school students.  Leading mock trials for elementary school students.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Motivated, personable, organized, and passionate about civic education. Excellent oral/written communication skills. Experience working with elementary and/or middle school students. Ability to multitask and collaborate. Familiar with Microsoft Word, Excel, and social media preferred.

attributes.site_name: Massachusetts Coalition for Occupational Safety & Health: Teens Lead at Work
attributes.title: Massachusetts Coalition for Occupational Safety & Health - Teens Lead at Work - Peer Leader
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Research, development, and implementation. Leading workshops on Health and Safety in the workplace. Investigating and addressing asthma triggers and other health risks that Boston teens face at school and in the community. Providing anti-violence and harassment prevention training. Leading educational activities for youth groups, such as ice-breakers, and leadership development activities. Conducting research and developing presentations on people, institutions, and events relevant to Child Labor Laws, workers' safety, and civic engagement.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Willingness to learn  Open Minded

attributes.title: Mattapan Food and Fitness Coalition - Mattapan Food and Fitness Coalition Vigorous Youth Leader
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Shaping and joining these key health and fitness projects: *Mobile Farm Stand/ Farmer's Market: work on your marketing skills, selling skills, customer service skills, product display skills, and promote healthy eating by providing fresh fruits and vegetables to customers Learning about Food Systems: Take field trips to local farms, community gardens, and participate in cooking demos, to gain knowledge of where food comes from and how it benefits you as an individual Gardening
attributes.ideal_candidate: Someone who has connection to the Mattapan Community. Able to work in a group. Open to learning new things. Able to ride a bike. Experience with public speaking skills. Interest in biking, gardening, farming, food access in general. Someone who wants to make a change in a community.

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: Bikes Not Bombs - Youth Pathways - Senior Instructor/Organizer
attributes.duties_responsbilities: The Assistant Instructor is the entry-level position in BNB's Pathways program. Youth serving in this role are expected to assist in the implementation of programs and aid in the success of mechanic lessons and bikes rides. The Lead Instructor is an upper-level instructor that is responsible for ensuring that programs operate smoothly.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Strong communication and presentation skills Decisive, good quality judgement/decision-making Professional conduct Interest in bikes and bike culture Interest in advancing socio-economic change  Demonstrated competency as a role model and peer leader Demonstrated competency in bicycle mechanics

attributes.title: Bikes Not Bombs - Youth Pathways - Mechanic and Sales Associate
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Customer Relations Positive and welcoming attitude in all customer service interactions. Interacting with customers, selling bicycles, accessories, and repair service. Understanding of inventory. Basic knowledge of what things are called and how to do repairs. Intermediate level - truing, parts replacement, build-ups. Master level - all advanced level mechanical jobs. Space and Facilities Keeping the shop organized and efficient - returning tools. Ability to stay organized and keep track of repair tickets and sales record.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Strong communication and presentation skills Decisive, good quality judgement/decision-making Professional conduct Interest in bikes and bike culture Interest in advancing socio-economic change  Demonstrated competency as a role model and peer leader Demonstrated competency in bicycle mechanics

attributes.category: Camp Counselor/ Summer Program Staff Support
attributes.title: Bikes Not Bombs - Youth Pathways - Assistant and Lead Instructor/Organizer
attributes.duties_responsbilities: This is a year round program for youth between the ages of 14-18 who are interested in learning to lead in their community. MJE's Peer Leadership Program develops community leaders among those teens most at risk for participation or exposure to gang-related or street violence and for involvement in the criminal justice system. Youth who participate in MJE's Peer Leadership Program are educated around social justice issues and empowered to utilize and apply their learning's in their community.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Strong communication and presentation skills Decisive, good quality judgement/decision-making Professional conduct Interest in bikes and bike culture Interest in advancing socio-economic change  Demonstrated competency as a role model and peer leader

attributes.title: Roxbury Youth Programs - Tour Guide
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Responsible for becoming local "experts" in history of the Roxbury area and the campus of the first Church of Roxbury, as well as provide an engaging presentation and tour to local college students, new residents, tourists groups, and school groups.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Someone with experience in presenting and who can quickly learn and navigate material. A dynamic student is ideal, as is someone who can work independently.

attributes.title: Roxbury Youth Programs - Peer Leader
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Be back-up tour guides, but will also be responsible for maintaining the operations of the summer program; including running discussion groups, helping in the kitchens, assisting with msc. administrative tasks, and leading their peers with insight, mentorship, and modeling of behavior/expectations.
attributes.ideal_candidate: A strong student with good leadership skills who can effectively lead and support programming; and be active, respectful participants.

attributes.site_name: Hawthorne Youth and Community Center: Grow it Cook it Share it and Summer Scene
attributes.title: Hawthorne Youth and Community Center - Grow it Cook it Share it and Summer Scene - Grow it Cook it Share it Crew
attributes.duties_responsbilities: To learn about open space design, architecture and community organizing.Be on time and come prepared to learn and work Clear communication with program coordinator and fellow GCS team members Community Engagement and outreach Teamwork and being a team player Some light building  At the start of programming, youth will learn Urban Farming and Culinary Skills. Throughout the summer, youth will be responsible for maintaining two farms.
attributes.ideal_candidate: This job is perfect for any youth who is interested in food/ food systems cooking or gardening, especially one that may live in a food desert or with some neighborhood food access difficulties. While being extroverted is not necessary, there will be some interaction with the public.

attributes.site_name: Hawthorne Youth and Community Center: Grow it Cook it Share it and Summer Scene
attributes.title: Hawthorne Youth and Community Center - Grow it Cook it Share it and Summer Scene - Summer Scene Crew
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Activating health and wellness activities, sports and other recreational activities at local parks in our neighborhood to ensure a fun and safe summer for neighborhood youth. They will also do a  community survey and focus groups using community organizing and data collection activities. They will be the main promoters of our summer offerings and support GCS youth with their community dinners by setting up and leading social justice dialogues.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Interested in sports, recreation, fitness, and/or health and wellness. Interested in helping young people in their community be healthy. Some knowledge of soccer, yoga, basketball, and other activities. Perfect job for someone who isn't a morning person (crew starts in the afternoon around 2/3pm).

attributes.site_name: FREEDOM HOUSE: PUSH High School Summer Institute
attributes.title: FREEDOM HOUSE - PUSH High School Summer Institute - PUSH High School Summer Scholar
attributes.duties_responsbilities: Provide consistent instructions, plan lessons and workout, maintain a safe clean functional facility and facilitate writing component of programming. Mentor coaches must be able to communicate clearly using a common program rhetoric. Must be able to manage delegate, and facilitate participant learning within the realms of personal fitness, holistic wellness, and program culture.
attributes.ideal_candidate: Passion for civic engagement and community service. Work with students who come from various levels of context/content when it comes to serving their community, speaking in public and leading their peers.  Interested in going outside of comfort zone and increasing ability to learn, lead, and serve.
